qas.question: What was the only Communist country allowed to have an embassy in Stroessner's Paraguay?
Yugoslavia was the only communist country to have an embassy where?
What country did Kjell Eugenio Laugerud Garcia lead?

context: Because of its neutrality, Yugoslavia would often be rare among Communist countries to have diplomatic relations with right-wing, anti-Communist governments. For example, <a0_0>Yugoslavia<a0_0/> was the only communist country allowed to have an embassy in <a1_0>Alfredo Stroessner's Paraguay<a1_0/>. One notable exception to Yugoslavia's neutral stance toward anti-communist countries was <a2_0>Chile<a2_0/> under Pinochet; Yugoslavia was one of many countries which severed diplomatic relations with Chile after Salvador <a3_0>Allende<a3_0/> was overthrown. Yugoslavia also provided military aid and arms supplies to staunchly anti-Communist regimes such as that of <a4_0>Guatemala<a4_0/> under Kjell Eugenio Laugerud García.
